ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.title: Botania
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.0: Explore the World and find White Mystical Flowers
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.1: The Petal Apothecary allows the player to infuse petals and runes to create generational and functional flowers.
Construct the Petal Apothecary
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.2: The Pure Daisy. It is mainly used for converting Wood and Stone into Livingwood and Livingrock respectively.
However, it can also convert Netherrack into Cobblestone, Blaze Mesh into Obsidian, Soul Sand into Sand, Ice into Packed Ice and Water into Snow.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.3: The Mana Pool is the primary block for Mana storage in Botania and can store an extremely large amount of Mana inside.
(100x more than the Diluted Mana Pool, or 1,000,000 Mana). Mana stored in the pool can be used to power other blocks in Botania that require Mana to function, such as functional flowers.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.4: The Mana Spreader is used to transport Mana.
The direction of the Mana bursts can be manipulated by shift-right clicking on it with the Wand of the Forest.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.5: The Runic Altar is used to craft runes.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.6: The Endoflame is a generating flower. It is the primary basic means of producing Mana.

The flower consumes any fuel dropped in a 7×7×7 area around it, then produces 3 Mana every 2 ticks for half of the fuel's burn time. For example, Charcoal is burned for 800 ticks (40 seconds), producing 1200 Mana.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.7: Livingrock is created by placing a block of Stone adjacent to a Pure Daisy. After a minute it will transform into Livingrock.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.8: Livingwood is created by placing any vanilla Wood Log next to a Pure Daisy. After a minute it will transform into Livingwood.
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.9: Runes, Manasteel Block \& Lapis Lazuli Blocks
Items for the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate Recipe
ftbquests.custom_quests.botania.quests.1: The Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate is a block and a structure. Its only use is crafting Terrasteel.
When a single Manasteel Ingot, Mana Diamond and Mana Pearl are dropped on the center of the structure, the crafting process will begin and the plate block will start accepting Mana.
While Mana can be provided with Mana Spreaders, the Lexica Botania recommends using Sparks for much higher transfer rates.
If any item is dropped on, picked up, or despawns from the Plate while crafting is ongoing, all progress will be lost and consumed Mana will not be recovered.
Once the Plate receives 500,000 Mana the three items will be turned into a single Terrasteel Ingot.
The Multiblock Structure setup can be found above this quest.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Terrasteel is created via an infusion ritual atop a Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate.
To form one Terrasteel Ingot, throw a Manasteel Ingot, a Mana Pearl, and a Mana Diamond onto the plate.
The plate then must receive 500,000 Mana (Sparks are the best way to do this), without any of the 3 items being picked up.

If any of the items are picked up, the infusion will fail. As an indication of progress, several wisps of glowing blue smoke will fly out from the plate, rotate, fade from blue to green, and finally crash together on the items, combining them into
terrasteel.

Note that the Manasteel ingot, Mana Pearl and Mana Diamond are treated as thrown items and thus would despawn after 5 minutes. Therefore, it is important to make sure you have enough mana to finish the ritual lest you lose your progress and items.
&7Reward: 2x Loot Bag
Portal to Alfheim
..this little one loves mana..
The Portal to Alfheim is a multiblock structure. It allows the player to exchange certain blocks and items.
Unlike most portals, the Portal to Alfheim cannot be travelled through, and if the player were to stand in it, it would not teleport them anywhere.
Note: If the portal runs out of Mana, or a part of the structure is broken, the Portal will close.
Even more information can be found on the Wiki here:
https://ftb.gamepedia.com/Portal_to_Alfheim
(The portal frame is 5x5)
Once the structure is complete, use the Wand of the Forest on the gateway core to open the portal.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Natura Pylon is used to create the Portal to Alfheim.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Elementium Ingots are created by throwing 2 Manasteel Ingots into a Portal to Alfheim.
It is used to make many items, most notably the Elven Mana Spreader and the Gaia Pylon.

ftbquests.custom_quests.dark_utilities.q: The blank plate is a crafting ingredient used to craft the other flat plate blocks in the mod.
It also serves as a decorative block. When other flat plate blocks are in their disabled state they will look the same as a blank plate.
&7Reward: 2 EXP Levels \& 2x Treasure &7Chest
Vector Plate
The Vector Plate is a flat tile that will push mobs and entities in the direction the arrow is facing.
Mobs can spawn on and in these tiles making them a good alternative to water in mob farms.

Vector plates have a fast and extreme variant which moves mobs at faster rates. The Vector Plate can be waterlogged by right clicking on it with a bucket. The Vector Plate is disabled when powered with redstone.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1 Treasure &7Chest.
Export Plate
The Export Plate is a variant of the Vector Plate that can extract items from connected inventories.
The export plate will try to extract items from the inventory of the block in the opposite direction of the arrow.
If that block has no inventory or the inventory is empty it will act like a normal Vector Plate. The fast and extreme variants will extract items at a faster rate in addition to moving them faster.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1 Treasure &7Chest.
Import Plate
The Import Plate is a variant of the Vector Plate that can insert items into inventories.
The Import Plate will try to insert any items dropped on it into the inventory of the block directly in front of the arrow.
If there is no inventory or the inventory is full it will behave like a normal Vector Plate. The fast and extreme variants will insert items at a faster rate in addition to moving them faster.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1 Treasure &7Chest.

Damage Trap
The damage trap will inflict 4 magic damage to any mob that collides with it. This damage is dealt every collision tick.
This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Player Damage Trap
The player damage trap will inflict 4 player damage to any mob that collides with it.
Player damage allows the mob to drop EXP on death and can also result in player-kill only drops. This damage is dealt every collision tick.
This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Alert Trap
The alert trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the glowing effect.
This effect renders a white outline around the mob which is visible through blocks and long distances.
This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Weakening Trap
The weakening trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the weakness debuff.
This debuff decreases the attack damage of the target. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal.
Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Slowing Trap
The slowing trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the slowness debuff.
This effect lowers the movement speed of the target. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal.
Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Withering Trap
The withering trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the wither debuff.
This effect will damage the target over time and make their hearts all black. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal.
Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Toxic Trap
The toxic trap will poison any mob that collides with it.
Poison will damage the target over time but they won't be killed. Many mobs like zombies are immune to poison and will not be affected
This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Hunger Trap
The hunger trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the hunger debuff.
This debuff lowers their food and saturation meter over time. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal.
Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces

This debuff makes the vision of the target darker. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal.
Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Disorientation Trap
The disorientation trap will inflict any mob that collides with it with the nausea debuff.

This debuff makes their camera go wavy and unfocused. This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
Traps mobs that stand on it. Forces them to look in the direction the block is facing.
This block can be disabled with a redstone signal. This block can be rotated by sneak + right click. This block can be waterlogged. Mobs can spawn on this block. This block can be waterlogged.

Flame Trap
The flame trap will set any mob that collides with it on fire.
This effect is disabled if the block is powered with a redstone signal. Mobs can spawn in and on top of this block. Additionally this block can be waterlogged.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Pieces
he sleep charm allows the wearer to instantly fall asleep in beds.
It will also slowly reduce the insomnia counter which will prevent phantoms from spawning and attacking you.
The item must be held in the inventory or offhand slot. It may also be worn as a charm if using the Curio mod.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The portal charm will allow the wearer to walk through portals instantly.
The item must be held in the inventory or offhand slot. It may also be worn as a charm if using the Curio mod.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The experience charm will decrease the pickup delay of experience orbs
It will also slightly increase the amount of experience dropped when killing mobs or mining blocks that drop EXP.
The item must be held in the inventory or offhand slot. It may also be worn as a charm if using the Curio mod.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The gluttony charm will allow the wearer to eat food without delay.
The item must be held in the inventory or offhand slot. It may also be worn as a charm if using the Curio mod.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The item grate is a simple block that allows items to fall through it.
Other mobs, even really small ones will not be able to fall through. Powering the grate with redstone will disable it and prevent anything from falling through.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1x Treasure &7Chest
An upgraded version of the hopper that can teleport nearby items into a connected inventory.
The squares on the top will glow purple when connected to a valid inventory. Has a radius of 9x9x9 centered on the hopper.
You can sneak + right click to display the collection border.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Dark Glass
Acts like a normal glass block allowing you to see through it.
It does not let light through, allowing it to be used around light sensitive blocks like mob spawners.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1x Treasure &7Chest
ftbquests.custom_quests.druidcraft.title: Druidcraft
ftbquests.custom_quests.druidcraft.quest: This can be acquired by mining the &6Fiery Glass Ore&r, found underground.
&7A little brighter than regular torches. &7Waterproof too!
&aAccelerates the growth of plants and &ababy animals within a 5x5x5 area!
&8Rockroot &fcan be more easily found higher up in the world. A good place to look is in the Mountains.
ftbquests.custom_quests.flux_networks.qu: Obtain some Flux
Obtained by dropping redstone between Obsidian \& Bedrock.
Obsidian on top and bedrock on the bottom- drop redstone between them and then left click the obsidian.
&o*loud noises*- Flux!
There is no limit to the amount of Redstone Dust you can use, each time
&7Reward: 2 EXP Levels
Required to activate Cross-dimensional inventory charging.
Inventory charging can be configured in the Wireless Charging Tab.
Only one controller can be connected to a network at one time.
The controller's 'Output' refers to energy outputted from the network via Wireless Charging.
&lNetwork's do not require a Flux &lController to operate

&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels \& 1x Loot Bag
Used to Store Energy in the network
Flux Storage is used to store excess energy. It will only be filled once each Flux Point has received enough energy.
&oTransfer Limit: 20000
This energy can only be accessed by removing energy with a Flux Point.

&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag

Can be used to access, edit, delete networks on the go.

Shift-Right Click on a connector to copy it's settings and then Right Click on a connector you wish to paste the settings to.
If you right click something which isn't a connector you'll bring up the Network GUI and also you'll be able to edit the settings which the Configurator will paste.
The configurator can also be renamed here, with the name field.

ftbquests.custom_quests.immersiveenginee: Immersive Engineering
The Engineer's Screwdriver is a common item in your toolbox, which you'll need to do precise configuration on certain pieces of machinery.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels
Coke Oven
x27 Coke Bricks are needed to form the Coke Oven. Simply place down the bricks in a 3x3x3 cube. Then right click the cube with the Engineer's Hammer.
The Coke Oven is a slow one, so I would recommend for the early game to have at least 2 or 3 Coke Ovens in order to get stocked up on Coal Coke.
1 Piece of Coal will produce 500mb of Creosote Oil, whilst a Log will only produce 250mb.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Blast Furnace
x27 Blast Bricks are needed to form the Blast Furnace. Simply place down the bricks in a 3x3x3 cube. Then right click the cube with the Engineer's Hammer.
The Blast Furnace will also produce Slag as a by-product.
Slag can be used in a Crusher to get Sand. Or used to create Concrete \& some other building blocks.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Craft the Engineer's Hammer.
The Engineer's Hammer is the most important tool at your disposal. It'll be used to form multiblocks like the Coke Oven and Blast Furnace.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Piece \& 2 EXP Levels.
Industrial Hemp, useful for the creation of Biodiesel, the hemp fibers are also used for the creation of Tough Fabric.
The Industrial Hemp Seeds can be obtained by breaking Tall Grass.
By using x3 Industrial Hemp Fibers in a crafting table they can be converted into 1 piece of string.

Alternatively these seeds can be obtained by using x4 DruidCraft 'Hemp Seeds' in a crafting table or inventory crafting grid. (2x2) - The Hemp Seeds from Druidcraft are obtained by breaking Tall or Short grass.
&7Reward: 5 EXP Levels
Tough Fabric is used in the creation of the Improved Windmill Blade \& Insulated Cables.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Steel Ingot
Steel is produced by putting Iron Ingots into the Blast Furnace. And by using Charcoal / Coal Coke as fuel.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The item Windmill Sail can be used on a Windmill by right-clicking with the item in hand on the Windmill.
A total of x8 Windmill Sails are required to max out a Windmill.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Acquire a bucket of Creosote Oil
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Treated Wood Planks
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Windmill Blades are used to create the Windmill. x8 of them are needed for each Windmill.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Windmill is able to produce a pretty decent amount of FE. The amount of FE produced depends on what altitude the Windmill is located at, and if it's raining or not.
The power generation can be increased by using Windmill Sails on the Windmill.
x8 Windmills Sails are needed for maximum power.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Waterwheel Segments are used to create the Water Wheel. x4 of them are needed for each Water Wheel.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Water Wheels are able to produce a good amount of FE, a max total of 3 water wheel can be put side by side.
The Kinetic Dynamo is required to get FE out of the Wheels.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Engineer's Wire Cutters is a tool used to disconnect the corresponding Wire Coil. It also has its uses in different recipes.
&7Reward: 3x Loot Bag Piece \& 2 EXP Levels.
Wire Connectors
Wire Connectors are used to input and output Energy (FE) from Wire Coils.
Engineer's Wire Cutters can be used to disconnect wires with a right-click.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Wire Relays are used to relay (connect) Wire Coils.
Engineer's Wire Cutters can be used to disconnect wires with a right-click.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Kinetic Dynamo generates Energy (FE) using a Windmill, Water Wheel, or Improved Windmill.
The Kinetic Dynamo generates more FE depending on how fast the Water Wheel / Windmill spins.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Wire Coils are used with Wire Connectors to power different blocks.
(TIP: Don't walk into these wires. They can be very electric.)
Consider upgrading these to insulated wires to not get zapped whilst trying to walk near them.
(This Wire Coil can only manage up to 2048 FE/t; for any higher, a MV Wire Coil is needed.)
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Wire Coils are used with Wire Connectors to power different blocks.
(TIP: Don't try to walk into these wires. They can be very electric.)
Consider upgrading these to insulated wires to not get zapped whilst trying to walk near them.
(This Wire Coil can only manage up to 8192 FE/t; for any higher, a HV Wire Coil is needed.)
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag

(TIP: Don't try to walk into these wires. They can be very electric.)
(This Wire Coil can manage up to 32768 FE/t.)
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag

A safer version of the LV Wire Coil. This Wire Coil won't zap you if you get too close.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag

These molds can be used in the Metal Press machine to easily produce Gears, Plates, Rods \& Wires.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Improved Blast Furnace

x27 Reinforced Blast Bricks \& 1 Hopper are needed to form the Improved Blast Furnace. Simply place down the Reinforced Blast Bricks in a 3x3x3 cube with a hopper ontop in the middle. Then right click the cube with the Engineer's Hammer.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Blast Furnace Preheaters
The Blast Furnace preheaters are used to speed up the Improved Blast Furnace using Energy (FE).
(Each preheater requires atleast 32 FE/t to function.)
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Craft an External Heater
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The LV Capacitor is a block that can store energy (FE). It can store up to 100,000 FE.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The MV Capacitor is a block that can store energy (FE). It can store up to 1,000,000 FE.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The HV Capacitor is a block that can store energy (FE). It can store up to 4,000,000 FE.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Engineer's Volt meter can be used to measure how much Energy (FE) is stored in a Capacitor.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Charging Station is a block that can be used to charge different items that require Energy (FE) to work.
The Energy (FE), transfer rate is 4000 FE/t
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Thermoelectric Generator generates Energy (FE) through the difference in temperature between blocks/liquids adjacent to it.
As an example Lava \& Water together generates 31FE/t.
For a full list of suitable liquids check out the Wiki here:
https://ftb.gamepedia.com/Thermoelectric_Generator
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
The Garden Cloche is a machine used to grow crops placed in it.
For more information regarding this machine head to the Wiki, found here:
https://ftb.gamepedia.com/Garden_Cloche
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Alloy Kiln
x8 Kiln Bricks are needed to form the Alloy Kiln. Simply place down the bricks in a 2x2 cube. Then right click the cube with the Engineer's Hammer.
The Alloy Kiln can be used to produce Alloys such as Invar \& Electrum.
Click the progress arrow inside the Kilns GUI to see all recipes.
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Metal Press Multiblock
The Metal Press is a 3x1x3 multi-block. It is used to create Plates, Rods \& Gears.
For more information regarding this Multiblock head over to the Wiki found here:
https://ftb.gamepedia.com/Metal_Press
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag
Crusher Multiblock
The Crusher is a 3x5x3 multi-block It is used for crushing Ores into Grit (Dusts).
For more information regarding this Multiblock head over to the Wiki found here:
https://ftb.gamepedia.com/Crusher_(Immersive_Engineering)
&7Reward: 1x Loot Bag

ftbquests.custom_quests.mekanism.title: Mekanism
The most basic item which most Mekanism machines and generators use. Crafted in the Metallurgic Infuser by infusing an Iron Ingot with Redstone, Redstone Blocks, or Compressed Redstone.
Upgraded version of the Enriched Alloy which some Mekanism machines and items use. Crafted in the Metallurgic Infuser by infusing an Enriched Alloy with Diamond Dust or Compressed Diamond.

Upgraded version of the Reinforced Alloy which some Mekanism machines and items use. Crafted in the Metallurgic Infuser by infusing a Reinforced Alloy with Refined Obsidian Dust or Compressed Obsidian.
The Basic Control Circuit is a Crafting Component used in the creation of multiple lower-tier machines.
An upgraded Basic Control Circuit, used in many tier 2 machines and items.
An upgraded Advanced Control Circuit, used in many tier 3 machines and items.
An upgraded Elite Control Circuit, used in many tier 4 machines and items.
Enriched Carbon is used in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Enriched Carbon yields 80 units of carbon in the infuser, the same as 8 coal or 4 charcoal.
Enriched Redstone is used in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Enriched Redstone yields 80 units of redstone in the Metallurgic Infuser, the same as 8 redstone.
Enriched Diamond is used in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Enriched Diamond yields 80 units of diamond in the Metallurgic Infuser, the same as 8 diamonds.
Enriched Obsidian is used in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Enriched Obsidian yields 80 units of obsidian in the Metallurgic Infuser, the same as 8 Refined Obsidian Dust.
Enriched Tin is used in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Enriched Tin yields 80 units of tin in the Metallurgic Infuser, the same as 8 Tin Dust.
The Basic Fluid Tank can hold up to 14000mB of fluids. It can double as a bucket by switching its mode to bucket mode.
The Advanced Fluid Tank can hold up to 28000mB of fluids which is double the amount of the Basic Fluid Tank. It can double as a bucket by switching its mode to bucket mode.
The Elite Fluid Tank is an upgraded version of the Advanced Fluid Tank that can hold 56000 mB of liquid. You can toggle its Bucket Mode on and off by shift-right clicking while holding it.
When Bucket Mode is on it can collect water and lava like a bucket. When Bucket Mode is off it can be placed like a block so you can attach Mechanical Pipe to it.
The Ultimate Fluid Tank is an upgraded version of the Elite Fluid Tank that can hold 112000 mB of liquid. You can toggle its Bucket Mode on and off by shift-right clicking while holding it.
When Bucket Mode is on it can collect water and lava like a bucket. When Bucket Mode is off it can be placed like a block so you can attach Mechanical Pipe to it.
An Energy Cube is an advanced type of battery that is compatible with multiple energy systems.
An Energy Cube is an advanced type of battery that is compatible with multiple energy systems.
&oAn upgraded version of the Basic Energy Cube.
An Energy Cube is an advanced type of battery that is compatible with multiple energy systems.
&oAn upgraded version of the Advanced Energy Cube.
An Energy Cube is an advanced type of battery that is compatible with multiple energy systems.
&oAn upgraded version of the Elite Energy Cube.
The Solar Generator harnesses sunlight to create power.
The Advanced Solar Generator is a highly upgraded version of the basic Solar Generator.
Construction of an Advanced Solar Generator requires four Solar Generators, but it produces six times the power of its smaller cousin.
It also requires an area of 3x3x3 Blocks in order to be placed.
A Wind Turbine's giant blades harness the force of the wind to generate power. Each Wind Turbine requires a fairly large 1x1x5 area.
The machine will generate power day and night, in sun or rain, but the turbine must have a clear view of the sky (over the rotor housing at the top of the tower).
The Flamethrower is a ranged weapon which uses Hydrogen gas as its fuel. It is fairly effective against mobs as it deals damage when they are directly hit with the stream and sets them on fire.
The Atomic Disassembler is Mekanism's an all-in-one tool, essentially the ultimate, electronic version of the paxel.
The Electric Bow works like the vanilla Bow and shoots normal Arrows.
The difference is, that every shot doesn't damage, but discharges the bow. If the internal energy storage is empty, the bow doesn't work and needs to be recharged e.g. on a Basic Energy Cube.
Craft a pair of Free Runners
Free Runners are an item that allows players to ascend 1-block inclines automatically (like the Horse), as well as preventing fall damage as long as they are charged.
A fall will reduce the item's charge, depending on how far the fall was.
The Energy Tablet is a portable, rechargeable battery pack that can be charged with up to 1,000kJ of energy and can then be used to power other devices.
It is also an ingredient in many recipes.
The Basic Bin is a storage block which can hold 4096 of a single item. It will retain its inventory when broken.
The Advanced Bin is a storage block which can hold 8192 of a single item. It will retain its inventory when broken.
The Elite Bin is a storage block which can hold 32,768 of a single item. It will retain its inventory when broken.
The Ultimate Bin is a storage block which can hold 262,144 of a single item. It will retain its inventory when broken.

The Crusher crushes, among other things, clumps into Dirty Dusts, Ingots into dusts and Biomatter into Bio Fuel.
The Metallurgic Infuser is the first step in the Mekanism tech tree.
It's a machine used in the production of Steel Ingots, Bronze Ingot, Enriched Alloy, and Obsidian Ingots.
The Purification Chamber uses oxygen to refine Ores and shards into clumps. Each ore makes 3 clumps, whereas each shard only gives one clump.
The energized smelter is your basic electric furnace that uses energy instead of fuel to smelt items.
The Rotary Condensentrator (pronounced "con-DEN-sen-traitor") is used for converting substances between liquid and gaseous forms at a rate of 1:1.
It has two modes: Decondensentrating, which turns Liquids into Gases, and Condensentrating, which turns Gases into Liquids.
The Chemical Oxidizer is used for making gases from materials. It's left side accepts incoming materials, while it's right side dispenses the gas created from those materials.
The Chemical Infuser combines or reacts two gases to create another gas.
The gas gauges on the left and right side of its GUI are the input tanks, and correspond to correspond with the left and right sides of the machine.
The gauge in the middle is for the resulting gas, which likewise is output through the front of the machine.
The Electrolytic Separator sends controlled amounts of direct current into a fluid, causing the atoms in the fluid to break their bonds.
The Precision Sawmill is used for reclaiming wood from wooden items and turn logs into planks with a 50% better yield (6 instead of 4). Also makes sawdust for use in making Cardboard Box.
The Chemical Dissolution Chamber is the first machine in the x5 ore processing setup.
The Chemical Washer turns Slurry into Clean Slurry using Water. The clean slurry then needs to be further refined by pumping it into a Chemical Crystallizer.
Note that unlike most Mekanism machines this one has fixed "in" and "out" sides for the mineral flow. "In" will be on the left when first placed and "out" is on the right.
The Chemical Crystallizer turns Clean Slurry into Crystals and lithium into lithium dust.
This is one of the select many machines in Mekanism to have dedicated, unchangeable sides for input and output.

The Pressurized Reaction Chamber (PRC) is used primarily to create Substrate (to create HDPE Pellets), HDPE Pellets (to create HDPE Sheets), and Ethylene (an efficient source of fuel used in the Gas-Burning Generator).
It has a variable speed and energy usage dependent on the materials/gasses it is creating.
Achieved by enriching Obsidian in the Enrichment Chamber.
Crafted by infusing Obsidian Dust with Diamond Dust or Compressed Diamond in the Metallurgic Infuser.
The Osmium Compressor is used to create Refined Obsidian Ingots from Refined Obsidian Dust and Glowstone Ingots from Glowstone Dust.
It fuses liquid Osmium (melted down Osmium Ingots placed in the machine's bottom slot) with the originating materials to create their corresponding ingots.
The Refined Obsidian Ingot is an ingot created by placing Refined Obsidian Dust into an Osmium Compressor fueled with Liquid Osmium (from Osmium Ingots).
The Digital Miner is the scale mining machine of Mekanism. However, this machine is like no other as it "magically-teleports" mined blocks to its inventory.
The Quantum Entangloporter is a machine that allows liquids/items/energy/gas to be sent from one Quantum Entangloporter to another through a channel.
The Quantum Entangloporter is similar to the Tesseract from earlier versions of Thermal Expansion, but the Quantum Entangloporter can send and receive gasses while the Tesseract cannot.
The Teleportation Core is a Crafting Component used in the crafting of the Portable Teleporter, the Teleporter and the Digital Miner.
Robit is Mekanism's mechanical companion. He can act as a crafting grid, a furnace, an anvil, a chest, or simply a cute little buddy.

The Chemical Injection Chamber uses Hydrogen Chloride gas to turn ores into 4 Shards. It is the start of x4 ore processing and requires a steady supply of Hydrogen Chloride, which in turn requires the player to have a Thermal Evaporation Plant runnin
It can also turn Water Vapor and Dirt into Clay. Like most Mekanism machines, the Chemical Injection Chamber has a Factory block of itself.
Steel Casing is a block used in the crafting recipe of most Mekanism machines.
The Steel Ingots for this quest can be acquired in the Blast Furnace from Immersive Engineering.
Crafted by the Metallurgic Infuser this is the basis from which Steel Dust can be attained by reprocessing it in the Metallurgic Infuser.
Steel Dust is produced by infusing an iron ingot with 10 units of carbon (producing Enriched Iron) and then infusing that with a further 10 units of Carbon.
A Steel Ingot is created by smelting Steel Dust in any type of furnace.
The Chargepad is a wireless electric charging station. Any rechargeable items you have in your inventory will be charged while standing on it.
The Teleporter Portal is a multi-block structure that allows the player to teleport between Teleporters on the same frequency.
Read more about it on the Wiki:
Glowstone Ingots are made by putting Glowstone in a powered Osmium Compressor with Glowstone in the top and Osmium Ingots in the bottom.
Glowstone Ingots can be used for making Glowstone Armor, Refined Glowstone blocks and Teleporter Frames.
Tier Installers are used to upgrade various machines into their Factory equivalent. Right-click on the machine with the Tier Installer and it will upgrade that machine
- its level (Basic, Advanced, or Elite) depending on the level of the Tier Installer used.
Tier Installers are used to upgrade various machines into their Factory equivalent. Right-click on the machine with the Tier Installer and it will upgrade that machine
- its level (Basic, Advanced, or Elite) depending on the level of the Tier Installer used.

ftbquests.custom_quests.mysticalagricult: Prosperity Base seed is basically used for any craftable seed.

By simply placing down the Altar it will display how you need to place the pedestals.
8 pedestals are needed to use the Infusion Altar.

Type '@mysticalagriculture augment' into the JEI search field to bring up all the augments at your disposal.
Grants additional souls from peaceful creatures.
Craft a Soulium Dagger with 2 Soulium Ingots \& 2 Soulium Dust, + a Gold Sword.
The Seed Reprocessor is used to transform a seed into its essence form.
For some seeds, the loot depends on the tier of the seed. For the recipes, please refer to JEI.
An Upgrade to the regular Seed Reprocessor.
An Upgrade to the Inferium Seed Reprocessor.
An Upgrade to the Prudentium Seed Reprocessor.
An Upgrade to the Tertium Seed Reprocessor.
An Upgrade to the Imperium Seed Reprocessor.

Soulium dust is acquired by Mining Soulium Ore in the Nether then Smelting it in an eligible furnace.

Break your way into a Nether Fortress

ftbquests.custom_quests.nether.quests.12: Have every Effect applied at the same time.

ftbquests.custom_quests.nether.quests.23: Ride a Strider with a Warped Fungus on a Stick
ftbquests.custom_quests.powah.title: Powah!
ftbquests.custom_quests.powah.quests.0.d: Powah is a tech mod that adds Various ways to generate, store, and transmit Forge Energy.
It provides several different types of energy generators, from the classic coal generator all the way to the self-building multiblock reactor.
All of Powah's machines are tier-based. You'll start with the appropriately named "starter" machines and upgrade them as you go.
The tiers are as follows: Starter, Basic, Hardened, Blazing, Niotic, Spirited and Nitro.
ftbquests.custom_quests.powah.quests.2.d: This is essentially Powah's machine frame.
Used in most of the machine recipes.
ftbquests.custom_quests.powah.quests.9.d: The Energizing Orb is used to craft the materials for the higher end machines.
To make a reactor, you need 36 reactor blocks.
When you hold the reactor blocks, you can look at the ground and a 3x3 shape will appear which will be red if you cannot build the reactor in that space.
Keep in mind the reactor is 4 blocks tall.
Uraninite is the fuel used in reactors.
ftbquests.custom_quests.powah.quests.115: Dry ice offers the best cooling for your reactor.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.title: PSI
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.0.sub: Infuse Redstone, Gold, Diamonds, Quartz, Coal.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.6.des: In the CAD Assembler you can combine your raw CAD assembly and basic components
to make a basic iron gun.
This will allow you to Trick:Infuse some Redstone Dust to get Psi Dust.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.11.su: Lets you know what the heck you doing!
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.12.de: Try Shift clicking on a Spell Table.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.43.de: Use with a Circle Bullet to smelt items on the floor.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.44.su: Let's you know what your CAD gun can accomplish.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.44.de: Total power draw used by Tricks.
Assemblys efficency, if you over draw you gurt yourself.
Affected by each spell part used on the grid.
How much space your spel can take up of the grid.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.45.su: Right click to launch yourself in the air.
ftbquests.custom_quests.psi.quests.45.de: Complete once you have done it!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.title: Rats!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.0.su: It's a Trash Can, not a Trash can't.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.0.de: Craft a trash can and right-click blocks into it to make garbage! Garbage attracts rats, which can do a variety of different things! Just keep them far away from your farms...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.1.su: Double the rats, double the fun!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.1.de: Compressed Garbage can be crafted with 9 garbage. It spawns double the amount of rats than normal garbage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.2.de: This staff will let you set your rat's home point, as well as any containers it may use.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.3.su: When two rats love each other very much...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.3.de: Used to contain and breed rats. Any rats that are riding on the player can be deposited in the cage by right clicking it. They can be released by clicking on the cage again. There is no limit to how many rats can be in a cage, but vanilla's entity cramming rules apply. Rat Tubes can also be connected to cages. Rat Cages connect to adjacent cage blocks to form one large cage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.4.de: Rats drop a variety of useful things. Plague rats randomly drop plague essence.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.5.de: Feed a rat some cheese to tame them. Rats can do a wide variety of tasks.
Drop the cheese on the ground for them to eat it.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.6.de: This item is used on a rat to summon a Rat King.
A Rat King is a terrifying mass of rats, tied together by their tails.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.7.de: The Rat King throws rats at the player to attack. Once he is slain, the rats he leaves behind can be tamed.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.8.de: Placing the rat with this upgrade above or below any block will accelerate the tickrate by an approximate a factor of five.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.9.de: Rat Upgrade: Basic is a Rat Upgrade with no unique abilities, rather it is used as a crafting ingredient to make more advanced Rat Upgrades.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.11.d: It is a tropical world filled with an endless archipelago, dotted with ruins made of Marbled Cheese. It was home to an extinct civilization known as the Ratlanteans, but now is populated by monstrous remnants of its ancient denizens.
The dimension is also a great place to mine for ores, as emeralds spawn in abundance underground. Oratchalcum is a unique ore found in this dimension.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.13.d: This ore only generates in Ratlantis.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.14.d: This armor, made from the remnants of many special rats and Oratchalcum, when worn, will summon spectral rats to protect you from harm.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.15.d: These tools, made from Oratchalcum, boast a variety of different abilities.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.16.d: This is used to place a portal to Ratlantis into the world and/or to craft the Rat Upgrade: Archeologist.
WARNING: Once the portal is placed in the world, it cannot be moved!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.17.d: Pour a Bucket of Milk in a Cauldron to make cheese!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.18.d: A Rat Crafting Table requires a rat with a Rat Upgrade: Crafting on top of the Rat Crafting Table to function.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.19.d: Pied Pipers are Illagers with even worse fashion sense. They summon hostile rats that will even attack villagers.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.20.d: The Rat Upgrade: Archeologist allows rats to research a held item and possibly transforming it into a Ratlantean artifact. The hat required in the recipe tends to drop from Husks.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.21.s: It's the fire that burns in my soul!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.21.d: These can be harvested from Ratlantean Spirits or gained by giving Blaze Powder to an Archeologist Rat.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.23.d: Ratglove flowers can be obtained both in Ratlantis or by giving an Archeologist Rat some Blue Orchids.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.24.d: This strange potion should bring a Feral Ratlantean to its senses... in theory.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.25.d: It worked... too well. Watch out for its psionic attacks!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.26.d: Attracts wild rats when powered on by redstone.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.27.d: Requires a rat with a Milkmaid Upgrade to use. A hopper and chest may provide better automation, with less checking for fullness necessary.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.28.s: Now it looks AND smells bad.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.28.d: Pied Garbage can be crafted with 1 compressed garbage and 9 Pied Wool. Instead of spawning rats, it spawns Pied Pipers.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.29.d: Purified garbage can be crafted with 8 Garbage and 1 Purifying Liquid. It works like normal Garbage, except that it will never spawn Plague Rats.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.31.d: Diseased garbage can be crafted with 8 Garbage and 1 Plague Essence. It works like normal Garbage, except that it spawns Plague Rats instead of normal rats.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.32.d: The automaton must be created using Ratlantean Automaton Core and a Ratlantean Automaton Head. It also requires 3 Marbled Cheese, of any kind. It is assembled in the same way a vanilla Iron Golem is.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.33.d: You can combine two upgrades with this upgrade, right click with this upgrade to add them to it.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.34.d: Rat Upgrade: Speed is a Rat Upgrade that makes rats move at twice the speed.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.35.d: Rat Upgrade: Platter will allow a rat to transfer an entire stack of an items at a time. Typically, a rat without this upgrade will only transfer a single item at a time.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.36.d: Grants a rat equipped with this upgrade 10 additional hearts (20 health).
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.37.d: The Rat Upgrade: Armor gives a rat 10 base Rat Armor.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.38.s: I used to be an adventurer like you...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.38.d: A rat with this upgrade uses a bow to attack. It has faster rate of attack than the crossbow but does lower damage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.39.d: A rat with this upgrade uses a crossbow to attack. Slower than the bow, but has higher damage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.40.s: "Potentially evil. Potentially good, too, I suppose."
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.40.d: Makes a rat fire and lava proof.
A rat with this upgrade also gains additional damage and health and can light enemies on fire.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.44.d: A rare drop from rats. Used to create a variety of things.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.45.s: "In what world could you possibly beat me?"
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.45.d: When equipped, the Rat Upgrade: Battle-God significantly increases the rat's base stats. Equipping the Upgrade also gives the rat an animated enchanted effect all over it's body.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.46.s: Don't worry, he washed his hands.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.46.d: This upgrade allows the rat to act as a sped up furnace and allows you to cook 3 new foods, Confit Byaldi, Potato Knishes and String Cheese.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.47.d: If given Assorted Vegetables, a Chef Rat will create this nostalgic dish.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.48.d: The Crafting upgrade allows a rat to automatically craft items for you. Once on top of the Rat Crafting Table, right-clicking the rat will open a menu where you manage the crafting.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.49.s: Get that out of your mouth!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.49.d: A rat with this upgrade will not pick up the items placed within it. Right click to open the GUI to add items to the blacklist.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.50.d: A rat with this upgrade will only pick up the items placed within it. Right click to open the GUI to add items to the whitelist.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.51.d: Rats with this upgrade will replant crops if they have seeds.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.52.d: A rat with this upgrade can fly!
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.53.s: You may be entitled to a settlement.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.53.d: The Rat Upgrade: Asbesto-Rat will grant a rat the ability to not take damage from fire, lava or magma.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.54.d: Gives the rat the ability to breathe fire and fly. It can use these abilities to complete tasks given to it, such as slaying mobs. WARNING: May burn down flammable blocks.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.56.d: Prevents a rat from taking suffocation or drowning damage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.57.d: When equipped, the Rat Upgrade: Aquatic gives the rat the ability to swim much more quickly, often leaping up and out of the water. The Upgrade also makes the rat able to breathe underwater, as well as changing it's appearance.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.58.d: A rat with this upgrade can teleport at will. It also gains black fur and glowing purple eyes. WARNING: Possibly bugged, rats may still prefer to walk to designated chests.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.59.d: Rats with this upgrade will harvest nearby wood blocks.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.60.d: A rat with this upgrade will mine ores. These ores cannot be specified with this upgrade.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.61.d: To assign materials, right-click with the Rat Upgrade: Miner to open the GUI which is used to set what blocks the rat will mine. 27 different blocks can be assigned to the upgrade.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.62.d: A rat with this upgrade will dig a quarry beneath a quarry block.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.63.s: No doubt about it, farming's hard work.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.63.d: A rat with this upgrade will harvest crops.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.64.d: The Rat Upgrade: Animal Breeder will allow a rat holding food to breed animals using their respective breeding item. The rat's command needs to set to "Harvest" in the Rat Menu to breed animals.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.65.s: It's a good day for fishin', ain't it?
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.65.d: Rats with this upgrade will fish when near a deep enough water source.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.67.d: Protects your rat from taking many different types of damage.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.68.s: Don't think about it too hard...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.68.d: Rats with this upgrade will refine certain ores into "nuggets". Smelt in a furnace to double ore output.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.69.d: The Rat Upgrade: Basic Energy Transfer allows a rat with this upgrade to transfer a max of 100 kRF at a time. RF and RE can be transferred. When collecting energy, the rat will only attempt to extract energy from the bottom face of the source block.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.70.d: The Rat Upgrade: Advanced Energy Transfer allows a rat with this upgrade to transfer a max of 500 kRF at a time. RF and RE can be transferred. When collecting energy, the rat will only attempt to extract energy from the bottom face of the source block.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.71.d: The Rat Upgrade: Elite Energy Transfer allows a rat with this upgrade to transfer a max of 1,000 kRF at a time. RF and RE can be transferred. When collecting energy, the rat will only attempt to extract energy from the bottom face of the source block.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.72.d: The Rat Upgrade: Extreme Energy Transfer allows a rat with this upgrade to transfer a max of 100,000 kRF at a time. RF and RE can be transferred. When collecting energy, the rat will only attempt to extract energy from the bottom face of the source block.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.73.d: This upgrade allows a rat to transfer fluids. However, it can only move 1 bucket at a time.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.74.d: This upgrade allws a rat to transfer fluids. It can move up to 5 buckets at a time.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.75.d: A rat will milk cows when set to harvest. It transfers fluids. This can be used to automate cheese production.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.76.d: Rats with this upgrade will shear nearby sheep.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.77.s: Money burning a hole in their pockets...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.77.d: The Rat Upgrade: Aristoc-Rat grants a rat the ability to drop Tiny Coins randomly or anytime it kills an enemy.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.81.s: I got friends on the other side...
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.81.d: Rat takes damage instead of its owner, only when within a certain distance. Damage is evenly distributed amongst multiple rats with this upgrade.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.82.s: Doesn't do what you think, yet.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.82.d: Used to create a few recipes that don't involve gemcutting.
In future updates may allow for the creation of cheaper rat upgrades.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.83.d: Allows rats to enchant any held item, granted that there are bookshelves nearby.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.84.d: This upgrade allows a rat to disenchant any held item.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.85.d: Rats with this hat only appear around Christmas-time.
Rats with this upgrade give presents every hour.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.87.d: This upgrade makes a rat orange... and edible?
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.88.s: Can't keep a good rat down.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.88.d: Upon being killed, a rat with the Angel upgrade equipped will appear as a ghost. After a minute, the rat will respawn.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.90.d: Used to make mounts for rats.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.91.d: A rat with this upgrade gets a quick chicken with a slow fall to ride upon.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.92.d: A rat with this upgrade gets a golem to ride.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.93.d: A rat with this upgrade gets a strider mount and thus can ride over lava.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.94.d: A rat with this upgrade rides upon a feral Ratlantean steed.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.95.d: This is an upgrade used in the Rat Upgrade Combiner to combine upgrades with this one. The result has the same properties of all of the components.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.96.d: Rat Upgrade: Basic Ratlantean is a Rat Upgrade with no unique abilities, rather it is used as a crafting ingredient to make more advanced Rat Upgrades.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.97.d: A rat with this upgrade rides on a Ratlantean Automaton.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.98.d: A rat with this upgrade gets a sweet bi-plane mount.
ftbquests.custom_quests.rats.quests.99.d: This upgrade enhances your rat's bite as well as makes them inflict poison and plague on your enemies.
Do what you want cuz a pirate is free!
Gives a rat with this upgrade a cannon that shoots cannonballs. WARNING: May crash servers.
This upgrade gives the rat 80 base armor as well as the ability to shoot lasers.
A rat with this upgrade gains the abilities of the Neo-Ratlantean. It also gains superior health regeneration.
I'm a ghost, I'm a ghost, I am a ghost and I go boo!
This upgrade allows your rat to float in the air as well as phase through blocks.

ftbquests.custom_quests.reliquary.quests: Cross of Mercy is a weapon that deals extra damage to undead mobs.
Death protection vial - shatters when the player would die, restores a bit of health and buffs the player with some helpful effects.
Angelic Feather protects against falling damage. On a fall that would hurt the player it instead drains players hunger.
Coin of Fortune when turned on teleports items and experience within range to player. If right click is held with the coin in hand the range in which items and experience are teleported is higher
Ender Staff is a teleportation tool. In ender pearl mode it allows throwing ender pearls in the similar way that you would do with just ender pearls in hand.
In ender eye mode the ender pearls thrown would go further and faster. In both modes when the ender pearl hits it teleports player in much safer way than vanilla ender pearl.
In wraith node mode ender staff teleports player to the wraith node that it is set to (by right clicking with the ender staff on the wraith node).
Glacial Staff is a ranged weapon that shoots snowballs out of its charge.
When turned on it drains these from player's inventory and it also freezes lava (into obsidian) and water (into packed ice) within player's reach so it allows walking on lava and water.
These frozen blocks will quickly melt back once outside of the range.
Infernal Chalice holds lava and based on mode it is in you can use it to place or remove lava in the world.
Lantern of Paranoia when on searches for dark spots around the player and places torches in those either from player's inventory or from Sojourner's Staff.
Emperor's Chalice is both infinite water bucket and empty bucket based on what mode it is in.
So you can use it to place or remove water in the world, but it can as well be used with Apothecary Cauldron, Botania's Petal Apothecary and Thaumcraft's Crucible.
You can also use it to refill your hunger in exchange for some health.
Phoenix Down is an upgraded version of Angelic Feather. It also prevents falling damage in exchange for player's hunger, but it also can prevent death.
In case the player would die otherwise it heals the player and buffs them with some helpful effects.
Hero's Medallion stores experience. When turned on it drains it from player. When turned off player can take one level out of it per right click.
One of the best food item in the game. Fills hunger and saturation fully.
Sojourner's Staff holds many torches that you can place by right clicking with it. It can also place torchers at distance for a higher torch cost.
Rending Gale in flight mode allows player to fly by pointing and right clicking. It can also push or pull mobs and if it rains there's a Bolt mode available that allows spawning lightnings.
When held it puts out fires around the player, it can also reflect ghast fireballs shot at the player.
Pyromancer's Staff has mutliple modes all related to fire.
In Blaze powder and Fire charge mode it shoots blaze and ghast sized fireballs. In Erupt it burns anything in range in front of the player.
And Flint and Steel mode works exactly as the vanilla flint and steel. It also destroys any fireballs shot at the player and puts out fires when turned off.
Shoots slime balls at enemies.
Makes mobs ignore player during night even if they are hit by the player.
Hoe Harvest rod is a farmers helper tool.
It can hoe the land, keep seeds/plantables in its inventory and plant these and keep bonemeal in its inventory and bonemeal with it.

All of these can either be done on a block player is pointing at by simple right click or in an area of effect by holding right click. It also breaks all crops in its range when player breaks one so it helps with speeding up harvesting as well.
If in player's inventory it prevents them from getting withered.
Prevents player from being hurt in fire in exchange for hunger.
Rod of Lyssa is a better fishing rod that in addition to usual fishing drops can do other things.
You can use it to fish items dropped in the world. Also can pull entities more than regular rod, more so vertically than horizontally.
Also if player is sneaking it can steal items from mob's inventory.
Powerful thrown explosive that can kill most of the mobs in one hit.
&dLilypad of Fertility
Lilypad of Fertility speeds up growth of crops around it.
You can also place multiples of these next to each other to get even faster speed.
A handgun that can be loaded with lots of different bullets.
Touchstone of Midas uses its glowstone charge to repair any gold based items in player's inventory. That includes Reliquary items like Cross of Mercy and Magic Bane.
Magic Bane is a special sword that can randomly buff mobs hit with negative buffs. Its damage will also improve with the number of enchantments applied to it.
Creates a wall of force that prevents entities from getting near.

ftbquests.custom_quests.thermalseries.qu: A Machine Frame, the core for machinery.
Machine Frames are the central component for many machines in Thermal Series. A Machine Frame must be crafted in order to craft a Machine.
A pulverizer is a machine that crushes items. It is commonly used to process ores and other items more efficiently, and to recycle certain items
A redstone furnace is a machine that smelts items.
A sawmill is a machine that processes wood into wood planks more efficiently than by hand. It can also be used to produce pulped biomass and to recycle various wooden things.
An induction smelter, or smelter for short, is a machine that smelts items together at high temperatures. Despite the name, the machine cannot be used for smelting.
A phytogenic insolator, or insolator for short, is a machine that grows and multiplies plants using water, fertilizer and simulated sunlight.
A centrifugal separator, or centrifuge for short, is a machine that separates items into their components.
A magma crucible, or crucible for short, is a machine that melts items into fluids.
The Multiservo Press is a machine that applies pressure to items to change their form.
A blast chiller, is a machine that freezes fluids into items.
A fractionating still (or still for short, also known as a refinery) is a machine that refines fluids.
An alchemical imbuer, also known as a brewer, is a machine that brews potions. It works with potions in their fluid forms.
A fluid transposer, or transposer for short, is a machine that fills and empties items that hold fluids, like buckets.
A sequential fabricator (also known as a crafter) is a machine that crafts items.
A stirling dynamo is a dynamo fueled by almost any burnable item. (Coal, wood etc.)
A compression dynamo is a dynamo fueled by Tree Oil and *maybe* other fluids + coolants.
A magmatic dynamo is a dynamo fueled by hot fluids like lava.
A numismatic dynamo is a dynamo fueled by currency, metal coins.
A lapidary dynamo is a dynamo fueled by gems, like emeralds and diamonds.
Redstone Flux Coils are crafting materials made of redstone and gold. They are used to craft things that can receive Redstone Flux, notably machines.
Used to upgrade a Machine to Hardened Tier.
Used to upgrade a Machine to Reinforced Tier.
Used to upgrade a Machine to Resonant Tier.
A fluxbore (also known as a drill) is a tool that mines blocks using Redstone Flux. It functions as both a pickaxe and a shovel.
A fluxsaw, or saw for short, is a tool that cuts blocks using Redstone Flux. It functions as an axe and shears.
A fluxomagnet, or magnet for short, is a tool that attracts dropped items using Redstone Flux.
A flux capacitor is an item that stores Redstone Flux and can use it to charge items in a player’s inventory.
Signalum security locks are items that can be installed on certain blocks and items to restrict who can access them.
A watering can is a tool that uses water to irrigate farmland and speed up plant growth.
A Potion Infuser (also known as an injector) is a tool that stores and injects fluid potions.
An alchemical quiver is an item that stores arrows and can automatically imbue them with fluid potions.
The Capacitato is a low-end battery good for moving energy into machines.
The Pyrolyzer is generally used for making Coke and Charcoal.
Redstone servos are crafting materials made of iron and redstone. They are used to craft things that do not need Redstone Flux to operate, notably devices.
The Aqueous Accumulator provides lots of water; but does not auto-output.
The fluid cell stores 32,000mb of water.
The Redstone Flux Cell stores up to 1,000,000 RF and has a transfer rate of 1k RF/t.
Requires a lava source and various other adjacent blocks.
The block under the Extruder may matter as well (for Basalt, for example).
Sucks up Items (and maybe XP) in an area.
Can use a Filter augment to restrict what it grabs.
Destroys Items and Fluids inserted into it via automation.
Items can be inserted manually via the GUI; a button is used to empty the inventory.
Can use a Filter augment to restrict valid items.
Redstone or Glowstone can be used to boost the potion strength or duration.
Charges up to 9 items with Redstone Flux.
Automation-compatible, but does not automatically transfer or have side configuration.
Can be placed in many different blocks to enable XP collection (from recipes). XP must be manually removed by a player.
Filter augments can be used in almost any block and will intelligently restrict input.
These work in some tools (Currently the FluxoMagnet).
Only a basic Item Filter for now. System is extensible and more filter types are coming.
An Efficiency Augment used in various Machines.

&7If you are lucky, the Ore Magnet will bring anything from an ore block to a whole vein right up to the surface for you. Each ore magnet will bring 24 blocks, and perhaps a few more to the surface.

A *fairly* simple extension of the vanilla furnace.
The Furnace Mk2 intends to stay within a defined design scope and prioritizes quality over quantity.
Features include increasing the speed, fuel efficiency, and experience output of the furnace, and an item to manage the experience produced (and player's experience).
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.title: Welcome!
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.0: Here's a starter kit for your endeavours!
To equip the Backpack, right-click while holding it. Then press 'B' or whatever buttons it's bound to, to open it.
Quests usually have Loot bags and EXP as rewards. Sometimes some other rewards!
The Loot from the Loot Bags can vary alot, maybe you'll get a really good item or just straight up some bad loot.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.1: You can sort your inventory or any other container by hovering your mouse in the container and pressing the 'Middle Mouse Button'.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.2: Struggling to find a specific item in your unorganized chests?
Then the tweak provided by the mod 'More Overlays' can help you!
Just write anything into the 'JEI' search field then double click the search bar. It'll highlight anything that matches your text.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.3: You will notice when you open a Crafting Table or a Crafting Station that there'll be 3 new buttons on the left side of the grid.
These buttons can be handy for either rotating around a recipe, or clearing the crafting grid fast.
There's also a button to evenly split a stack into every slot.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.4: Be sure to take advantage of the Trash Slot in your inventory.
You can safely place an item in the Trash Slot without erasing it- But as soon as you place another item in the slot it'll delete the previous item. Be careful!
The Trash Slot is really handy if you just need to get rid of items while in a hurry, or just cleaing up.
(Is your Trash Slot missing? Press 'T' in your inventory as you might've accidentally toggled it.)
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.5: You're able to claim chunks to protect your base(s). Just click the map icon that is located top left in your inventory.
This will bring up a fullscreen map, but this isn't the map we're looking for. Click the map again top left corner.
Here you can freely claim available chunks by just drawing on the map with your mouse. (Left click and drag.)
To unclaim a chunk you do the opposite, just draw but hold 'Right Click' instead.
(To Chunkload a Chunk you do as explained above but now you need to hold down 'LSHIFT' while dragging over an existing claimed chunk.)
A total of 500 chunks can be claimed per player / per team.
A maximum of 25 chunks can be chunk-loaded per player / per team.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.6: Think of it like the mod Baubles, allowing you to equip certain items like the Backpack from the mod 'Backpacked' or the 'Angel Ring' without having it in your main inventory.
You will notice while playing that some items have a tooltip displaying that they can be equipped in the Curious Menu.
The Curious GUI menu can be access by clicking the Coin like icon top left in your inventory. Next to your character.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.7: Ever found a specific sound that is annoying you?
Well then I have good news for you!
In Limitless 3 there's a mod that allows you to mute specific sounds.
Simply head into your inventory and click the Muffle button top right of your character render.
When you've clicked it a GUI will open up and a list of recently played sounds will be displayed. Just left click the one you want to mute and then you're golden! (Click again to unmute.)
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.8: Most of the modded keybinds are unbinded.
Go into options, controls and bind whatever Key you need on your desired button.
This is to prevent annoying cases where some mods uses the same button.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.9: &7Eat unique food types and level up &7your total health!
A mod designed to encourage dietary variety!
It does so by rewarding the player for eating a variety of foods instead of punishing them for failing to diversify.
The mod keeps track of how many unique foods a player has eaten. As they pass certain milestone amounts of unique foods, they permanently gain new hearts, increasing their max health!
In order to max out their HP bars, players will have to quest for and craft exotic foods.
ftbquests.custom_quests.welcome.quests.1: Info on Parties \& Syncable Quest Progression.
You can have your Questing Progress sync to other &aplayers &fif you're in a &2party.
To create a &2party &fyou will need to run the following command: &a/ftbteams party create &2<NAME>
You can then invite a &aplayer &fto your &2party &fwith the following command: &a/ftbteam party invite &2<PLAYER>
The &aplayer &fyou invited will receive an invite notifcation in the chat, which they can click to accept.
To leave a &2party &fyou can run the following command: &a/ftbteams party &2leave
&c(If the party leader removes the party, all quest progression will be lost.)
&c(Any quests completed before joining a party will be lost.)
Zooming! Yes, there's a mod called SmoothFocus that allows you to zoom like you can in OptiFine.
When zoomed in you can use your scroll wheel to choose how far you want to be zoomed in.
